data.text:
@westaustralian yet only vaxxed can work and visit there...
ARE WE AWAKE YET...!!!!

@watch2o @_marching_Ents_ @westaustralian @AnthDeCeglie If you are suggesting he compromised those who had their booster early (of whom, I was one), how do you explain the low hospitalisation rates? Getting the timing right was going to be difficult but heath professionals know better than @AnthDeCeglie
@themasksremoved @westaustralian I was a mental health nurse until sacked due to refusing the jab. Not graylands though.

@mag_down_under2 @westaustralian Probably politics. Not enough beds. Spent the money fear mongering WA to believe we needed extra policing, roadblocks at regional boundaries, hundreds of licence plate readers, quarantine ... rather than health?

@mag_down_under2 @westaustralian The clients/patients have covid, they are infecting others in their *shared* rooms as well as nurses, Dr's & staff. All covid positive people should've been isolated together. Charlie's hospital was meant to be used. WA had more time to prepare. Spent it on policing?
@watch2o @westaustralian Hang on, who are you saying has covid?
@mag_down_under2 @westaustralian You have little idea. They're 'critical workers. WA is short staffed, remember. The patients are also immunocompromised & vulnerable.
